title: Commending Edward K. Peisker VFW Post 5348, Deer Park, New York upon the occasion of the celebration of its 65th Anniversary on January 22, 2011
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION commending Edward K. Peisker VFW Post 5348, Deer
Park, New York upon the occasion of the celebration of its 65th Anniver-
sary on January 22, 2011

WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to commend and support
the purposeful cause of the Veterans  of  Foreign  Wars  of  the  United
States  of  America (VFW), recognizing its long and sustained commitment
to the principles of democracy and freedom so revered by this State  and
nation; and
  WHEREAS,  In keeping with time-honored traditions, it is the intent of
this Legislative Body to recognize the just purpose and  good  works  of
Edward  K. Peisker VFW Post 5348, Deer Park, New York, upon the occasion
of its 65th Anniversary, to be celebrated with a gala  65th  Anniversary
Dinner Dance to be held at the Post on Saturday, January 22, 2011; and
  WHEREAS,  Founded  in  1899  by  veterans of the Spanish American War,
returning first from Cuba and later from the Philippines,  the  Veterans
of  Foreign Wars has, for more than 100 years, been dedicated to serving
America's veterans and their families; to preserving freedom, democracy,
and the American way of life;  and  to  maintaining  a  strong  national
defense; and
  WHEREAS,  More than six decades ago a small group of veterans gathered
and decided to organize a Deer Park Post of the VFW; on January 26, 1946
Edward K. Peisker VFW Post 5348 was chartered by the national  organiza-
tion  and a few weeks later, on February 11, 1946, a companion organiza-
tion, the Deer Park Veterans'  Association,  Inc.  was  incorporated  to
acquire and maintain a home for the Post; and
  WHEREAS,  Shortly  thereafter  the  Association  purchased  the former
Beck's Tavern on Long Island  Avenue  which,  though  the  building  has
undergone  several  expansions  and  renovations, it continues to be the
home of Edward K. Peisker VFW Post 5348 and the focal point of many Deer
Park and Suffolk County activities; and
  WHEREAS, On March 6, 1992 an early morning fire caused  severe  damage
to  the  hall;  thanks to the quick response and outstanding containment
efforts of the Deer Park Volunteer Fire Department total destruction was
averted and, on January 23, 1993, the building was rededicated; and
  WHEREAS, Over the years the Post has  hosted  the  community's  annual
Dahlia  Ball;  many  Deer  Park  Volunteer  Fire Department Installation
Dinners, Boy Scout Meetings,  Little  League  Registrations  and  Awards
Dinners;  more  weddings, christenings, anniversary and birthday parties
than can be counted and, of course, the Post's own famous St.  Patrick's
Day, New Years Eve and Anniversary Dances; and
  WHEREAS,  In  addition,  during  the  area's building boom of the late
1950's and early 1960's, when Saints Cyril and Methodius Catholic Church
could no longer accommodate its growing numbers, Edward K.  Peisker  VFW
Post  5348  welcomed  its  parishioners  and made its hall available for
Sunday Masses; and
  WHEREAS, Post 5348 and its members have always  been  active  in  many
veterans'  and  community  affairs;  the  Post has organized and led the
community's Memorial Day Parade since 1946 and, in conjunction with that
important remembrance, its members also conduct their annual Buddy Poppy
Drive to assist area veterans in need and place an American flag on each
Pinelawn National Cemetery grave; and
  WHEREAS, Edward K. Peisker Post members, in addition, visit the Veter-
ans Administration Hospital in Northport  every  month,  arrange  annual
Halloween  and  Christmas parties at the hospital and annually visit the
Tomb of the Unknown Soldier at Arlington National Cemetery; and

  WHEREAS, They also sponsor youth sports, participate in  the  communi-
ty's  various parades and tree lighting ceremonies as well as the Veter-
ans' Outreach food drives and the United States Marine Corps'  Toys  for
Tots program; and
  WHEREAS,  Edward  K.  Peisker  VFW Post 5348 is most proud to have, or
have had, members who have served in every branch of the  United  States
Armed  Forces and in each of our nation's conflicts from the Spanish-Am-
erican War to, and beyond, Desert Storm; and
  WHEREAS, Edward K. Peisker VFW Post 5348  has  faithfully  served  the
Deer  Park community and its veterans over the past 65 years, dedicating
its purpose to the preservation of the values  and  principles  of  this
great republic; and
  WHEREAS, The 65th Anniversary of the founding of Edward K. Peisker VFW
Post  5348  is  a time to pause and reflect on the events it conducts in
reverent tribute to the men  and  women  who  served  their  country  in
defense  of  its  ideals  of democracy and freedom, on the many contrib-
utions rendered to community organizations and educational programs, and
on its continuing efforts to serve veterans and the Deer Park community;
and
  WHEREAS, Edward K. Peisker VFW Post 5348 is a noble post,  accomplish-
ing its mission and performing its good deeds in a spirit of comradeship
true to the highest traditions of the Veterans of Foreign Wars; and
  WHEREAS,  Mindful  of its proud and honored history, Edward K. Peisker
VFW Post 5348 may celebrate with just pride and  true  honor,  its  65th
Anniversary  of  service  to  its  community and the needs and causes of
veterans across New York State and the nation; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  to  commend  the
devoted leadership of Edward K. Peisker VFW Post 5348's Post Commanders,
past and present, and the absolute commitment of its many proud members,
noting  the role played by this exceptional organization and recognizing
the significance of the contributions and sacrifices of its  membership;
now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
commend Edward K. Peisker VFW Post 5348 upon the occasion of  the  cele-
bration  of  its  65th  Anniversary on January 22, 2011, fully confident
that the quality and character of life in the Empire State remains rich-
ly endowed and resolutely defended through such  organizations  of  just
cause and good purpose; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Edward K. Peisker VFW Post 5348, Deer Park, New York.
